page.title: 13History from the Street Map
page.content: { Street and Place Names}give us an insight into the{history of Windsor. Dedworth(Dideorde) and Clewer (Clivore) are ancient areas of Windsor.{Spital}is a Medieval name for the area near the Leper{hospital}of St. Peters. Goswell is derived from the goose stream and meadow. Street names give a wealth of clues about the past. For example{Peascod {street}led to the Peas croft (field). Sheet street was beside a field called Sheet. Most Windsor streets are modern and refer to the original site. Other street names remind us of {landowners}or{famous residents. Testwood,Pierson and Fulmer were the Windsor Martyrs'. Galley, Carey, Keppel and Barry were M.P.'s; whilst Bolton, Bulkley, Dyson, Ellison, Camm and Luff were well known residents.
